data.title: Paris Gare-de-Lyon train station: Access - Map - Contact
data.meta_description: Here, youâ€™ll find information on how to get to Gare de Lyon and travel around Paris by taxi, metro, RER, bus and car, including parking.
data.text:
Originally constructed as the â€˜EmbarcadÃ¨re de Lyonâ€™ in 1847, Paris Gare-de-Lyon train station has undergone several extensions and reconstructions, notably on the occasion of the 1900 Paris Exposition.

It is located in the heart of the 12th arrondissement and is now one of the six largest stations in Paris, and the second busiest in terms of daily traffic. Weâ€™ve prepared a list of everything you need to know before arriving at Paris Gare-de-Lyon train station, including information about access, parking, lockers, etc.

Metro: lines 1 and 14

RER: lines A and D

Bus : lignes 24, 29, 57, 61, 63, 65, 72, 77, 87, 91

Parisâ€™s extensive public transport network will help you get around the capital.

Click here to access an interactive map of Paris Metro! It operates 7 days a week until 01:15 on week days and until 02:15 on Friday evenings, Saturday evenings and the day before public holidays.

ðŸ’¡ Our tip: Download the RATP app for seamless travel all over Paris.

To make your life easier, you can purchase your Paris Metro tickets from the buffet coach in the middle of the train.

Would you prefer to visit Paris without your luggage in tow?

You can use the luggage storage service at Paris Gare-de-Lyon train station, which are open every day from 6:15 am to 10 pm. The cost depends on the size of the luggage and the duration of storage. Please see the Gare de Lyon website for more information.
